abstract.p:
In July 1993, the Starlink Panel reviewed the existing local management arrangements, based on the Area Management Committees (AMCs), and decided to introduce a number of reforms. The new arrangements, which are the subject of this paper, concentrate the old AMC responsibilities into one individual at each site called the Site Chairman, leaving it up to that individual to set up the consultative machinery appropriate to his or her community. Sites normally opt to set up committees much like the old LMCs or AMCs, but adapted to suit local needs.
A prospective Site Chairman proposes and agrees with the Starlink Project Scientist local procedures for consulting and representing users which are acceptable to both Starlink and the Institution. The effectiveness of these procedures is kept under review; accreditation of the Site Chairman is renewed annually.
